1.text: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

2.text: The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.

3.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

4.text: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter the second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?

5.text: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and [of] the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

6.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

7.text: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

8.text: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

9.text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?

10.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?

11.text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.

12.text: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you [of] heavenly things?

13.text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, [even] the Son of man which is in heaven.

14.text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:

15.text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

16.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

17.text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

18.text: He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

19.text: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

20.text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.

21.text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.

22.text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.

23.text: And John also was baptizing in AEnon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

24.text: For John was not yet cast into prison.

25.text: Then there arose a question between [some] of John’s disciples and the Jews about purifying.

26.text: And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all [men] come to him.

27.text: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.

28.text: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.

29.text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.

30.text: He must increase, but I [must] decrease.

31.text: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.

32.text: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.

33.text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.

34.text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure [unto him].

35.text: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

36.text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.
